result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Michael Niemeyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Lafayette County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall serve 10 days in the Lafayette County Jail commending forthwith.
Defendant shall be entitled to work release.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:03 AM.
Defendant Kevin Michael Niemeyer in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Bucher informs the court this matter is resolved.
Defendant changes plea from "NOT GUILTY" to "NO CONTEST" Count 1
Court questions defendant re: plea and waiver of rights, court also questions attorney Bucher re: her clients plea and waiver.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, knowingly & intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY" to Count 1
State moves for joint recommendation of the parties
Attorney Bucher concurs with the state.
Court accepts agreement and orders defendant to 10 days in the Lafayette County Jail
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 27, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Kevin Michael Niemeyer in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Bucher informs the court this matter is resolved and moves for a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 10:30 am.
